reviews.content: My wife needed a local doctor, so she tried Soni Family Practice. I went with her when she had an appointment with Dr. Harlow. She was fantastic! She really spent a lot of time with us asking lots of questions in order to point us in the right direction for a full diagnosis. If I didn't already have a doctor, I would come here. You can tell she loves what she does and is good with her patients. . Their office looks new and is well kept. The wait was very minimal in the waiting room our nurse was also great.

I have been a patient at this practice for years. I've had a few issues in that time, but nothing major. I will say, even though Dr Soni is my primary care doctor, I have never actually met the woman. I've always been seen by nurses or PA's.. I went to see my ophthalmologist recently and they determined that I need to have eye surgery. I saw the surgeon last week and they scheduled the surgery for two weeks out, with my pre-op appointment next week. I just got the registration paperwork for the surgery center today and there's a medical release form that I need to have signed by my PCP. . I have no medical conditions, take no medications, and I'm relatively young and healthy, no problems. So I called and asked if they'd sign it, but of course they won't without an appointment. That's fine, I understand. My pre-op appointment is next week, but Dr Soni's office doesn't have availability for three to four weeks!! And the receptionist was very rude! I explained that I need this surgery and I need to have this form signed so that I can have it done, and she said "What do you want me to do? I can't double book the physician!" in a snotty tone.. UNBELIEVABLE!! I'm done with this place!

My children were patients here for over a year before I was able to change physicians. I was also a patient. . I can really only recommend two of the nurses (who were very nice). I did not like Dr. Soni whatsoever nor really the assistants who frequently see you. . She did not have very good bedside manner - and I found she did not really listen to us. She was very pushy with certain medications & just not on the same page as myself or my children . Was very happy to change physicians. I can't recommend Dr. Soni or her clinic, personally. . Ps wait times can be very excessive & the scheduling nurse has a poor attitude (even toward the other nurses).

Dr. Soni is a really nice lady.  However if your sick and need to see her forget it. You can't get in. Was at the ER over the weekend needed to see my primary care doctor. Nothing available for a week.  I understand they are busy but this happens every time I try to see her guess that's why I ended up in the ER. My hunt for a primary doctor continues.

Waited a whole month to show to my "scheduled" appointment, only to find out this people is so disorganized they didn't even showed an appointment scheduled! Requested to speak to the administrator, he wasn't even courteous enough to give his face! TERRIBLE PLACE! I WOULDN'T RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE!!!
The is the doctor to see. She was patient and kind. She listened and asked great questions. I highly recommend Dr. Soni for your primary doctor!
This is an excellent practice with a friendly and quick staff. Dr. Soni made me feel heard and cared for. I would recommend this practice to anyone!
